[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Mashbot defines requirements for managing social presence, scheduling, analytics, and content distribution.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: Mashbot unifies social interfaces for campaign management, tracking, and publishing.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: Mashbot integrates with social media APIs and databases for content management.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: Mashbot provides a web-based interface for campaign scheduling and monitoring.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: Mashbot supports devices with modern web browsers.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: Mashbot relies on HTTP/1.1, HTML5, and RESTful APIs for communication.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: Mashbot secures communication using HTTPS and SMTP.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: Mashbot requires 1GB server RAM and 256MB client RAM.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: Mashbot operates 24/7 with failover and backup mechanisms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: Mashbot is customizable for different roles and organization sizes.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: Mashbot links to platforms like Facebook for content publishing.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: Mashbot supports scheduling, publishing, and campaign analytics.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Mashbot is designed for business users familiar with social media operations.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: Mashbot depends on API availability and a stable internet connection.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: Mashbot requires valid user accounts and network connectivity.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: External Account: Linked social media account.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with external social media APIs for publishing and data aggregation.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall support secure email notifications using SMTP.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow users to schedule and publish campaign content (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall provide analytics dashboards for campaign performance (REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall enable role-based access for content management (REQ-DSGN-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The platform shall offer an intuitive web interface with drag-and-drop scheduling.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall include help documentation and tutorials (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process user actions within 2 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The platform shall support up to 500 concurrent users without degradation.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store campaign data and user preferences (REQ-FUNC-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The database shall support querying by campaign, user, and date (REQ-FUNC-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The platform shall comply with open web standards like HTML5 and CSS3.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall use modular architecture for scalability (REQ-FUNC-003).

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to GDPR standards for data protection.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log critical actions for auditing and provide real-time error notifications.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Unit, integration, and user testing ensure functional and compliance requirements.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, FAQs, and training modules.
[SEC] 5. References: Mashbot documentation, GDPR guidelines, and social media API specifications.
